intro: Stachyarrhena revoluta, commonly known as the woolly bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and bright red or pink floral spikes. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions. Stachyarrhena revoluta is also valued for its ecological role, providing nectar for native pollinators.
